duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide diagnostic assessment, onsite crisis assessment and intervention, and determine need for ongoing care according to level of clinical ability, medical, and psychosocial complexity.
Develop treatment plans and implement treatment interventions specific to patient needs.
Continually assess patient's progress and revise diagnosis(es), treatment plans, and interventions accordingly.
Conduct scheduled face-to-face therapy sessions designed to assess and improve patient's emotional, mental, and behavioral health.
Provide treatment for patients with severe and persistent mental illness, including community-based interventions aimed at improving daily living skills, social skills, and self-regulation skills.

Provide treatment for patients requiring a higher level of care than outpatient therapy, including assessment and diagnosis, individual and group therapy, development, implementation, and evaluation of therapy programs.
Stay current on emerging issues in the profession.

education_certification.credential: Master's degree in Counseling, Social Work, Psychology, or related Behavioral Health Sciences required; graduation from an accredited school preferred. License must be in good standing in state(s) of practice.
